t: Proverbs 23
When*p thou sittest to eat with a ruler, consider diligently what is before thee:
And*p put a knife to thy throat, if thou be a man given to appetite.
Be*p not desirous of his dainties: for they are deceitful meat.
Labour*p not to be rich: cease from thine own wisdom.
Wilt*p thou set thine eyes upon that which is not? for riches certainly make themselves wings; they fly away as an eagle toward heaven.
Eat*p thou not the bread of him that hath an evil eye, neither desire thou his dainty meats:
For*p as he thinketh in his heart, so is he: Eat and drink, saith he to thee; but his heart is not with thee.
The*p morsel which thou hast eaten shalt thou vomit up, and lose thy sweet words.
Speak*p not in the ears of a fool: for he will despise the wisdom of thy words.
Remove*p not the old landmark; and enter not into the fields of the fatherless:
For*p their redeemer is mighty; he shall plead their cause with thee.
Apply*p thine heart unto instruction, and thine ears to the words of knowledge.
Withhold*p not correction from the child: for if thou beatest him with the rod, he shall not die.
Thou*p shalt beat him with the rod, and shalt deliver his soul from hell.
My*p son, if thine heart be wise, my heart shall rejoice, even mine.
Yea,*p my reins shall rejoice, when thy lips speak right things.
Let*p not thine heart envy sinners: but be thou in the fear of the Lord*s all the day long.
For*p surely there is an end; and thine expectation shall not be cut off.
Hear*p thou, my son, and be wise, and guide thine heart in the way.
Be*p not among winebibbers; among riotous eaters of flesh:
For*p the drunkard and the glutton shall come to poverty: and drowsiness shall clothe a man with rags.
Hearken*p unto thy father that begat thee, and despise not thy mother when she is old.
Buy*p the truth, and sell it not; also wisdom, and instruction, and understanding.
The*p father of the righteous shall greatly rejoice: and he that begetteth a wise child shall have joy of him.
Thy*p father and thy mother shall be glad, and she that bare thee shall rejoice.
My*p son, give me thine heart, and let thine eyes observe my ways.
For*p a whore is a deep ditch; and a strange woman is a narrow pit.
She*p also lieth in wait as for a prey, and increaseth the transgressors among men.
Who*p hath woe? who hath sorrow? who hath contentions? who hath babbling? who hath wounds without cause? who hath redness of eyes?
They*p that tarry long at the wine; they that go to seek mixed wine.
Look*p not thou upon the wine when it is red, when it giveth his colour in the cup, when it moveth itself aright.
At*p the last it biteth like a serpent, and stingeth like an adder.
Thine*p eyes shall behold strange women, and thine heart shall utter perverse things.
Yea,*p thou shalt be as he that lieth down in the midst of the sea, or as he that lieth upon the top of a mast.
They*p have stricken me, shalt thou say, and I was not sick; they have beaten me, and I felt it not: when shall I awake? I will seek it yet again.
